revised_title: Amino Acid Sequence Analysis of Bence-Jones Proteins and Immunoglobulins
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the chemical structure and amino acid sequence of Bence-Jones proteins, which are light chains of antibodies. They found that these proteins have a fixed and variable portion in their sequence. The study also revealed that the amino acid interchanges in the light chains are clustered around specific regions, which may define a portion of the antigen-combining site in the light chains of antibodies. The authors also discovered a strong correlation between the amino acid at position 189 and the Inv genetic factor in the light chains.
